laboratory_examinations.findings: Bicuspid aortic valve with moderate regurgitation, mildly to moderately dilated and hypertrophied left ventricle, ejection fraction of 50%.
High-velocity retrograde flow in the left vertebral artery which reduced on exertion.
Stenosis of the subclavian artery and subclavian steal ruled out.
Worsening (moderate to severe) aortic insufficiency with a clearly visible asymmetrical diastolic flow jet, mild decrease of left ventricular ejection fraction.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening of aortic insufficiency correlating with progression of symptoms.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated high flow in both the native aorta and bypass graft with substantial diastolic retrograde flow throughout the system; retrograde fractions in several arteries reduced after administration of atropine.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Retrograde flow in the system decreased after atropine administration.
